This is a real ancient game from the ancient Athens with boards and letters.
There are 2-6 players. Each player has ancient letters from Athens Attica Hellas.
Also there are tree dices with the ancient Greek shapes of Athens.
The player with the highest roll play first.

Attica contains the following items:
1. Some Color Boards.
2. Ancient Athens Attica letters with different color for each player.
3. Tree dice with different shapes.
4. Many other items.
And a 32-page leaflet with some information for this game with many photos from the ancient Athens Attica Greece, the land of the Goddess Athena.

6247.description: An oldie. Pegity is a game where players insert wooden pegs into a punch board. The object is to get five pegs of your color in a row. There are also little pieces of paper inside with designs on them, such as a house, doll boat, etc... which younger children could make with the game's contents instead of actually playing the game. Not a particularly rare or great game, but probably an early 20th century borrower from the game of Go-Moku, much earlier than say Othello for example.
6247.name: Pegity

boardgamecompilation: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot Deluxe Limited Edition
6248.description:
This is the RED Booster expansion to the non-collectible, hysterical Killer Bunnies game. This expansion includes 55 new cards and a red 12 sided die.

The addition of this expansion will add more Bunnies to the deck (Red Bunnies, to be exact, each with their own special "power") and 4 more Carrots, making a total of sixteen to try to collect. The expansion also adds a new market to the game - Rooney's Weapons Emporium, where you can buy back used weapons and get Defense Cards, adding a whole new level of strategy to the game! Other new and hilarious "spoof" cards and loads of new evil weapons make this a worthwhile addition to the starter deck.

From the back of the box:
"Can you defeat the Quite Irascible Diffractable Cheese Balls? Can you even say Quite Irascible Diffractable Cheese Balls? Send bunnies three rounds ahead in time with Bunny To The Future! The laughs continue as this wild and wacky Red Booster Deck delivers more intense strategy and even more Carrot grabbin' fun!"

Expands:

Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot
boardgameversion: German metal box second red / violet edition
6248.name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot RED Booster

boardgamehonor: 2003 Deutscher Spiele Preis Best Family/Adult Game 2nd Place
2003 Essener Feder Best Written Rules Winner
2003 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2003 Spiel des Jahres Nominee
2003 Spiel des Jahres Winner
2004 Hra roku Nominee
2005 Årets Spill Best Family Game Nominee
2005 Årets Spill Best Family Game Winner
2005 Hra roku Nominee
2005 Juego del Año Finalist
2005 Nederlandse Spellenprijs Nominee
2005 Vuoden Peli Adult Game of the Year Nominee
2005 Vuoden Peli Adult Game of the Year Winner
6249.description:
Granada, 1278. At the foot of the Sierra Nevada mountains, one of the most exciting and interesting project of the Spanish Middle Ages begins: the construction of the ALHAMBRA.

The best master builders in the whole of Europe and Arabia want to demonstrate their skill. Employ the most suitable teams of builders and make sure that you always have enough of the right currency. Because no matter whether they are stonemasons from the north or horticulturalists from the south, they all want a proper wage and insist on their "native" currency. With their help towers can be constructed, gardens laid out, pavilions and arcades erected and seraglios and chambers built.

In Alhambra, players are acquiring buildings to be placed within their Alhambra complex.

The money in Alhambra comes in four different currencies and is available in the open money market. The 54 buildings of six types become available for purchase in the building market four at a time; one building is available in each of the four different currencies. On a player's turn, a player may 1) take money from the open money market, 2) purchase a building from the building market and either place it in his Alhambra or reserve, or 3) engage in construction and re-construction projects with buildings that have been placed in the player's Alhambra or reserve. The game rewards efficiency, as when a player purchases a building from the market for the exact amount of money, the player may take another turn.

Players with the most buildings in each of the six building types in his Alhambra score in each of the scoring phases, and points are awarded for players' longest external "wall" section within their complex. The game ends when the building market can no longer be replenished from the building tile supply, and there is a final scoring, whereupon the player with the highest score wins.

Integrates with:

Alhambra: The Dice Game (a variant in which you can combine Alhambra buildings with Alhambra dice.)
boardgameversion: Queen German SdJ edition with English rules
6249.name: Alhambra
boardgamepodcastepisode: 3. Devon Dice Podcast Presents... a review of 2015 part 1
BGA Episode 100 - Top 100 Games of All Time
BGTG - May 30, 2005 (SR: Struggle of Empires, Alhambra, Flowerpower)
Durchgespielt – Spiel des Jahres 2003: Der Palast von Alhambra
EP3：伊比利亚半岛上摩尔人最后的堡垒
Heavy Cardboard Episode 39 – Top 50 Favorite Games of Right Now
I've Been Diced! episode 11: How many sessions before judgment?
Podcast #043 - Guia de compras y recomendaciones de juegos de mesa 2011 Parte 1
The Good, The Board, and The Tired: Episode 12 Tabletop Day

6250.description: 'Chez Geek' set in the army. Once again, players attempt to gain slack in any way that they can. Food, jobs, nookie... apparently the army is more fun than you thought.
6250.name: Chez Grunt

boardgameimplementation: ATS Core Module: Arnhem – One Bridge... Too Far 1944
6251.description:
The Battle of Arnhem in super detail, with a building by building map with big hexes (you can put a bunch of counters in each one).


10 mostly small scenarios
Two sheets of die cut counters with new art - big 3/4" AFV counters including lots of unusual German AFVs
Giant-hex two sheet map depicting downtown Arnhem in September 1944
Super-sized deluxe AFV cards for all AFV types
Sturdy box
Two ten-sided dice
Four Play Aid cards


The tank counters are 3/4" across - the largest AFV counter of any tactical-level system on the market. The personnel counters are 5/8" each.

Mostly a two or four-player game - it seems to play very quickly. There is a Basic Game included that explains all of the rules in a simple format. It takes about a half hour to get comfortable with tanks, infantry and terrain and start really playing. Very solid and extremely nice production values.
6251.name: Arnhem: Defiant Stand

6252.name: Chaos Chess
6252.description: This is a set of 80 cards that change all the rules of chess. The cards range from permanent changes to "instants" to durational cards. It adds an element of luck to a game that never had any. However, most the cards are not over-powerful and your knowledge of chess will help you quite a bit. The game is still Chess at its core. Each card has its own art and flavor text, both of which are very well done. You will probably want some extra tokens beyond the initial 8 that are supplied. You will use tokens a lot in this game.

boardgamehonor: 1977 Charles S. Roberts Best Tactical Nominee
6253.description:
SPI's monster game of the Battle of the Bulge. 4 maps.
This is a grand tactical simulation of the Battle of the Bulge. Recreate the decisive engagement that represented Hitler's last major effort to win the Second World War.
Not a simple game to learn, but once mastered a very enjoyable game.
6253.name: Wacht am Rhein
boardgamefamily: World War 2: Battle of the Bulge
boardgamepodcastepisode: I've Been Diced! episode 57: Greg Smith on The Hunters and computer wargames

6254.description:
Centered around the family dog, Harley, who likes to hide our Favorite Things, The Adventures of Harley is a co-operative children's game. The goal is to move Harley around the board and turn over cards from four stacks, revealing Dangerous Animals (Bear, Raccoon, Skunk, Porcupine), nasty Briar Patches, Dog Powers (Bark and Sniff), and Favorite Things (such as gloves, sneakers, socks, etc.). Dangerous Animals and Briar Patches block Harley's travels to the various locations as he tries to find the Favorite Things. As a co-operative game, everyone loses together or wins together!

Ages 5-9.
6254.name: The Adventures of Harley

6255.name: Signs Up
6255.description:
Equipment:
-Playing board, 4 playing pieces, 14 Sign cards, 32 Movements cards, Money

OBJECT
To be the player with the most money after all the signs are placed in the proper order.

Simple and attractive children game. Combine letters and numbers skills.
The different signs of the 7 shops (TO-YS, BA-NK, PE-TS, FI-RE, PO-ST, MI-LK, BO-OK) have been misplaced. Players will collect them and placed them on the right places. Movement is not by dice, but by CARDS (like in fast 111s). Each card reads a nice riddle/rhyme, like for example:

"PUTTING UP SIGNS IS SOMETIMES A CHORE,
ADD 2 AND 2 AND MOVE AHEAD ---- "
(this one will obviously move 4)

Other cards will send you directly to a particular shop, or entitle to steal a sign from another player, etc, etc Additionally, players can steal signs when meeting on the board, as long as they don't have more than 2 at anytime in the hand.

Every sign a player place on the right place is rewarded with 10 US !! The player with most money at the end is the winner.

So, LETTERS, NUMBERS, COLORFUL BOARD AND MONEY. A good mix for children!!!

6263.description:
The king has invited you to his castle for breakfast. During the feast the players will take portions of various dishes from the table to eat. As a good host, the king will serve all his guests before taking any portion from each course. From time to time, his pet dragon Emerald will steal some food from his master. Of course, it is rude for a player to have more of a dish than the king, so players must be careful not to be too greedy. In the end, the winner is the player who gets the most to eat of the things the king likes best without eating more than the king eats of any dish.

Online Play


BrettspielWelt (real-time)
6263.name: King's Breakfast

6264.description:
Bohnaparte conquers the Bohnreich! The fourth Bohnanza expansion from Lookout Games (in a limited sales edition of 2500 pieces) puts you in the Bohnreich! Plantations, villages, cities, fortresses -- and 3 to 5 generals, who want to bring these under their control.

The Bohnanza base game is needed. Using new cards in Bohnaparte, the Bohnreich is laid out; each player receives counters of his own color; and play then loosely follows that of normal Bohnanza, with a small difference: earned bean coins are not saved but are used to finance your conquests throughout the Bohnreich. At the end it matters only who has the largest part of the Bohnreich under control. Battling is accomplished using the numbers on the bean cards, which gives new significance to the formerly "weaker" bean types. Designer Hanno Girke describes the expansion set as "Bohnanza meets Risk".

Includes 33 cards, 60 game markers, and rules. Graphics by Marcel-Andre Casasola Merkle.

The AMIGO-Edition of Bohnaparte includes 50 Cards, 72 game markers and rules.
6264.name: Bohnaparte

boardgameimplementation: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: Jack the Ripper & West End Adventures
6266.description:
Standalone expansion for Sherlock Holmes, Consulting Detective.

Packaged in a 2-inch bookshelf style box.

Contains:

Case Book
Clue Book
Newspaper archive
London Directory (2nd edition)
Map of Holmes London




Six Cases Included:

The Strange Case of Doctor Goldfire
The Murder of Sherlock Holmes
A Case of Identity
The Death of a Transylvanian Count
A Royal Huggermunger at the Savage Club
A Simple Case of Murder
6266.name: West End Adventures

6267.name: WWII Skirmish
6267.description:
Skirmish is a basic introduction to wargaming. Think of it as a game of chess on steroids. When most wargames fall short of enjoyment because of game length and complexity (Most last between 6-80 hours and take even longer to learn) we have kept this game simple and enjoyable so it can be learned and played in as short as 15 minutes. Of course we have longer scenarios too for those of you who enjoy a longer game! Various game scenarios are included with an open-ended ability for you to add your own, making it a game guaranteed never to collect dust on your game shelf!

For details see http://www.biglittlegames.com/skirmish.php

6268.name: Maze
6268.description: A co-operative two player game that has the flavor of chess. Each player starts with two pieces, called "Mates", that s/he must exchange places with the other player. There are six other types of pieces with various moving powers. The challenge of the game is to figure how to move the other pieces out of the way so that the Mates can freely move.

6269.name: Wall Street
6269.description: Maintaining Net Worth is the key to becoming the winner. Buy stocks when they are down and sell when they are up--unless you are Selling Short. Once you have enough capital, "walk" the Chairman of the Board to assess liens on your competition and force them into bankruptcy. A series of 300 cards determine how stock prices fluctuate.

boardgamehonor: 1978 Charles S. Roberts Best Fantasy / Futuristic Board Game Nominee
6270.description:
Objective: Moscow is a land/sea/air game of the hypothetical invasion of the former U.S.S.R. in the late 1970s and at the end of the 20th century. The area depicted on the map covers from Paris to Turkey, to Iraq and central Asia, to China as far south as Peking, to Japan, Korea, and Alaska. In all, units of more than 30 nations are included. This is truly a 'World War' monster game set in Modern times.

Several scenarios are postulated, including a NATO counteroffensive after a Soviet invasion of Western Europe, a Chinese invasion of Siberia, and an Iranian campaign of expansion in the Middle East. Scenarios taking place later postulate an alliance of the USA, a United Europe, Iran, China, and other countries joining for the conquest of the Soviet Union.

Contains: 24 page rulebook; 1,200 colorful die cut cardboard playing pieces; four 22" x 34" hexagonal grid soft map sections; and various playing aids. This game came in a flat plastic pack or a 'detergent soap' sized box. An excellent solitaire as well as 3-player game.
6270.name: Objective Moscow: The Death of Soviet Communism

6271.name: You Need Drew's Truck
6271.description:
A cute little game where you have large items you need to get home and a mutual friend Drew has a truck that can transport those things for you. Competition revolves around getting the truck to go where you want it to go and arranging for there to be room in the truck for your things.

Aside from moving the truck around the board, there are also cards you can play to repack the truck, drop things off the truck, give other players flat tires or bad backs or otherwise impede their progress.

The truck is metal and the things are differently shaped magnets. Very much like Tetris in a moving vehicle.

Online Play

CCG Workshop (no longer available)

6272.description:
A children's variant of the classic strategy game using a special die to decide combat, rather than a value system. Each team consists of wizards, princesses, knights etc.

At the near and far edges of the board are three spaces, where players place their "major" pieces (flag, jester and the robber baron) in any order. The first player to capture the other's flag is the winner.
6272.name: Junior Stratego

6273.name: Worldwide Wines
6273.description:
A card and board game where a wine novice can beat a connoisseur.
Worldwide Wines patented mode of play features "Region Cards", which provide the game's strategic element and "Money Cards", which educate players to the many aspects of wines of the world.
Players must collect and BUY certain combinations of "Region Cards", which relate directly to the 106 wine regions on the game board map (Winning "R. Card" Combinations:3 stars/$24 Million each OR 4 wine bottles/$18 Million each OR 5 wine glasses/$14 Million each OR a "flush").
Over 300 "Money Cards" present players with a wide range of challenging questions and interesting facts on the wine regions, their wine styles and production methods. The "Money Cards" also give OR take away the cash needed to buy strategic "Region Cards". WILD "Opportunity Cards" (included in the "Region Card" deck) give players the opportunity to buy owned "Region Cards" right out from under opponents.
All players have an equal chance of winning due to the "Region Card" strategy aspect.

6274.name: Power Power: The Werecat Card Battle
6274.description:
A card game where you try to raise your catgirl (a girl with cat-like features, such as cat-ears and a tail) from a kitten to an adult before the other players do so with their own catgirl.

A version 2.00 was released with a new set of cards and new rules (not just 'errata' fixes or minor tweaks, but a reworking).

6275.description:
A fantasy collectible card game with many of the same themes as Magic: The Gathering. You have a bunch of monsters that you move along land that it set between the two players (with the monsters actually on the land, unlike Magic, but somewhat like the CCG 'Guardians').

Was fairly popular, with at about 4 expansions before a sequel was produced.
6275.name: Monster Collection

6276.name: High School of Blitz
6276.description: An unusual collectible card game that centers on cute characters as its selling point. Each player plays someone who has become class president of a girl’s high school classroom, and tries to raise a group to save the world from destruction (and battle against the other classes).

6277.name: Vampire Savior Trading Card Game
6277.description:
Based off the Vampire Savior arcade game. Each player takes a particular character, and constructs a deck with attacks usable by that character, and fight it out.

While there was a release of a "Vampire Savior 2", it really doesn't warrant a separate entry, as it is just the characters from the arcade game that the first series didn't cover.

6278.description: One on one collectible card game with a strong emphasis on cute girls drawn by a variety of artists. The theme goes all over the place (fantasy, science fiction, etc). Was very popular, spawning a ton of expansions, multiple art books, a sequel game( Aquarian Age 2), drama CDs, anime, and misc. other merchandise.
6278.name: Aquarian Age

6279.name: Girls High School Athletic Festival
6279.description: Try to overcome different difficult athletic events while trying to become the most successful at a high school athletics festival (at least, more successful than the other players). Use items to improve your odds of winning.

6280.name: Langrisser Trading Card Game
6280.description:
Collectible trading card game based off the Langrisser video game series. The main set is based off Langrissers 1-5, and has art by Satoshi Urushihara. There was one expansion set produced, based off Langrisser Millenium, but has a different artist than the main set.

The game has many similarities to Magic, but some major differences, such as no land cards. However, you have generals and monsters that you use to protect 'yourself' much the same way monsters protect 'yourself' in Magic.

6281.description:
This text refers to the Queen 2007 reprint. The older edition had players write down their viking orders and was two rounds longer.

In Eketorp, players build Viking strongholds upon the Swedish island of Öland.

The goal of the game is to collect the most valuable blocks to build your own fortress, either by winning battles on the resource spaces or by stealing blocks from other vikings.

Each turn, new resources appear and the players secretly plan their viking movements. After all the placements are revealed, vikings battle each other for blocks (with the losers sent off to the field hospital to recover). The game ends after a set number of rounds, or when one of the players has succeeded in finishing their fortress.
6281.name: Eketorp

boardgamehonor: 1980 Charles S. Roberts Best Fantasy or Science-Fiction Board Game Nominee
1980 Charles S. Roberts Best Fantasy or Science-Fiction Board Game Winner
6282.description:
From the rulebook: Azhanti High Lightning is a game of close-action combat between individuals on board a large military spaceship. The game covers the weapons and personal abilities which can reasonably be expected aboard a starship; tactics and strategies then become the realm of player input. A variety of scenarios are provided, and many more can be generated using the components included in the game."

A "square and counter" supplement to Traveler, similar to Snapshot. Each turn is 15 seconds, each square 1.5 meters, counters represent one individual or animal.
6282.name: Azhanti High Lightning
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

6283.description:
The UNGAME was designed for YOU to experience the fun of learning how to communicate more effectively. As you share thoughts, ideas and feelings, you will develop a deeper understanding of others and of yourself. Each person's ability to respond and become involved will improve as he continues to TELL IT LIKE IT IS. You'll find the UNGAME both entertaining AND educational.

The UNGAME is appropriate with friends, for family circles, classrooms, committees, counseling groups, and at any social gathering.

From two to six people can participate and there is no competition! Everyone wins! So follow the rules and have a most enjoyable time TELLING IT LIKE IT IS!

Games last for a predesignated amount of time agreed upon by the players prior to the start. 1 hour - 45 minutes is recommended. Players take turns rolling and moving. When your piece lands on a space, you do what that space says, usually draw a card or answer the question on the board. The goal of the game is to connect to the other players on a deeper level. Only the individual players can determine to what extent they have won.

Themes for the game and depth of questions shift with varying decks of cards and expansions.

Ostensibly, this is Outside the Scope of BGG, but is kept in the database by fiat due to history.
6283.name: The Ungame

6284.description:
Summary: The shark goes around in circle devouring fish. The last fish left un-eaten is the winner.
Text on back of box:

DON'T GET GULPED!

It's a race! And a chase! And a swim-for-your-life escape! You are one of four little fish that encounter a shark with a ferocious appetite. You've got to move -- and move fast!

Roll the dice and move your fish. But watch out! If you're not fast enough, the motorized shark creeps up behind and swallows your fish. You're out of the game. The last fish to escape that shark's bite wins the game.
6284.name: Shark Attack!

6285.name: Monster Jam Truck Game
6285.description: Monster Jam Truck Game: In this fast-paced never-before-seen game, kids can re-create the rugged challenges and outrageous antics they see on Monster Jam® television shows. This is the first board game to feature the massively popular Monster Trucks. The game features Hot Wheels licenses, including He-Man and Gravedigger, the hottest Monster Truck around. Cards guide the players through the jumps and stunts of the game.

6287.name: RPM
6287.description: RPM is a word game played on a revolving board. The board is divided into 4 quarters. Each quarter has a top and bottom section. The object of the game is to form and capture words of 2 or more letters by placing letter tiles, one per quarter, as the board revolves. All players make their moves at the same time. The board makes exactly 5 revolutions before it is automatically stopped. This gives each player 20 opportunities to place his tiles. Colored tiles are used to capture completed words.

6288.name: Max Roll
6288.description:
From the Box:

"Have you ever had a few minutes between games or between turns in a long game and needed something to do? This is just the game for you. Get your friends and play this simple, fast, real-time game of pattern recognition. You can adjust the level of difficulty to suit the time available and skill of those involved. A few of the hundreds of variants are supplied with the game.

Contents:
1 Playing mat with inscribed scoring and example patterns.
1 Set of the required dice [each player needs own set].
1 Instruction sheet. "

6289.name: Stock Market: The Wall Street Trading Game
6289.description: The idea of the game is to trade stocks: buying, selling and selling short so profitably that one becomes the richest trader and the winner. A player is chosen to 'function' as the Stockbroker. The Market is opened with the turning up of the top Ticker Tape, then unlimited trading in lots of 100 shares may begin. News Cards affect stock prices up and down. A Record is kept of every trade and each change in price. A Market Closing Time is set, at which time all trading stops. Players and Broker settle up at the last price on the record. The game is one of fun, excitement, skill, and educational value.

6290.name: Home You Go
6290.description:
"A very simple yet exciting family game for 2 OR 4 players Ages 6 and up"

Yes , very simple rules. Each player has 5 men of the same color. These men have to be moved to the other side of the board to win. Movement is by dice and only straight forward (no change of direction allowed).

When players land in other player pieces that second piece goes back to the start : HOME YOU GO!!

The fun is when 4 people play, as "attackers" will come from all the 3 sides!!! as the board becomes more and more busy.

It has some simple strategy. Children and adults will like it.

6291.name: Hole in One Golf Card Game
6291.description:
A simple card game designed to replicate a round of golf. Separate the cards into 6 decks. Correct order - Driver, Long Iron, Short Iron, Wedge, Putter.
1. Game follows the established rules of golf.
2. Driver must be used to tee off on par-4 and par-5 holes.
3. Short Iron must be used to tee off on par-3 holes.
4. Each card shows strokes and next club to be used.
5. All driver shots must be completed before Woods or Long Irons.
6. All Woods and Long Irons must be completed before Short Irons.
7. All short Iron shots must be completed before Putter.
8. All Wedge shots must be completed before Putter.
9. Fringe of green putts first followed by farthest distance from cup.
10. All Putters putt out before next opponent or opponents putt.
11. Replay nine holes for eighteen hole score.
12. One, two, three or four people may play.
13. All cards must be re-shuffled after each hole.
14. High score on each hole shuffles. Low score tees off first.

6292.name: Monster Maker Resurrection: The Monster Maker TCG
6292.description:
Fantasy game with the Monster Maker characters. Vaguely similar to Magic, but only in the broadest sense.

Unlike the rest of the Mosnter Maker card games, this one is a collectible card game where players construct their won decks, instead of a fixed-deck set. Also, while the original artist does have cards he drew in this set, it is the first Monster Maker card game to use art from a variety or artists.

There are expansion sets produced for this game.

6293.name: Hourai Card Game: Ganbare Athletics Meet
6293.description:
A card game based off a high school athletics competition.

Cards with different values to the winner are used to represent different competitions, and you also have characters with different levels of athletic ability to use to try to win them. You can't reuse your athletes, so you'd like to use your best athlete for a high value competition, but then again, your opponents would want to do the same, and you may use your best athlete in hand for nothing because someone else has an even better one; whereas you could have used a lousy athlete in that case and while still would lose that competition, still have a very good athlete to use later.

6294.name: Dragoons in the Donjons
6294.description: Instead of a few adventurers entering a dungeon to fight monsters, in this game, a militia goes down into the dungeon. That militia is composed of the likes of pikeman and infantry.

6295.name: Dragon Panic
6295.description:
A fantasy card game in which each player draws a character card and victory conditions card to start the game. An example of a victory condition would be "Gather 600 gold so you can buy medicine to cure your lover who's fallen ill."

there are many locations in the dungeon, and certain monsters can only be played in certain locations. Each monster card shows its name, strength, where it can appear, the treasure it carries, and the experience gained for killing the monster. There are of course items and weapons to help you.

6296.name: Space Emperor
6296.description: In this game, each player uses his Spaceship and Super Weapon cards to attack the other players, and try to take over territory in space.

6297.name: Super Daisenryaku
6297.description:
Contemporary war card game. There are six groups (mostly countries, but NATO is one of them) that fight, and each unit card is usable by only certain countries.

Air, naval, and ground attacks are all covered, and there are event cards for things like ammunition shortages as well.

6298.name: Tokyo Crisis
6298.description: In this game, you play detectives trying to do the best job solving crimes. Different crimes have different success level rankings in 3 different categories, with a value attached to solving the crime. You want to solve 1500 points worth of crimes before the other players.

6299.name: Flash Fighter
6299.description: Science fiction mecha fighting game. The object is to be the last player alive. There are weapon, defense, support, and special cards. You power up your robot with those cards and try to defeat everyone else's robots.

6300.name: Panic High School
6300.description: A card game set in recent/modern day Japan. Enlist the use of various school clubs (such as the Chemistry Club and Bunny-Girl Club) to help you in your quest to command the school via taking over the most territory in it.

6301.name: Alien High School
6301.description: Alien Highschool is a Japanese card game in which aliens have been infiltrating the Earth for more than 10 years. Their target is a super-weapon that lies beneath a metropolitan high school for girls. When the students learned of their plans, they band together to fend off the secret invasion. Players assume the roles of these students and use their cards to foil the alien schemes. When all incidents have been resolved, the player who foiled the most schemes is the winner. One of the player, however, could be an alien in disguise and might betray the team at any time.

6302.name: Tower Quest
6302.description:
Tower Quest is a card game set in a fantasy world. Players attempt to collect a set of cards to become the winner.

Each player is given a hand of 7 cards at the start, while all the other cards are mixed into a common deck. One player starts the game by drawing a card from the deck and playing it. Character cards (those with an icon) are placed face down, while other cards are played face up. Going clockwise, the next player plays a card of higher value from his or her hand or passes. The player who drew and played the initial card is the last to decide whether to play a card of higher value or not. The player who played the highest value card in the pile gains the initial card into his or her collection; all other cards are discarded. Players replenish their hands after the conclusion of this round and the next round begins with the next player.

Once a player has collected a pre-determined set of Character cards (based on their icons), he or she can call an end to the game. The players tally their scores from the cards in their hand and collection, and add any bonuses (for ending the game, the collected Character cards, etc). The player with the highest score is the winner.

6303.name: Monster Hunt
6303.description:
A fantasy game with unique monsters as opposed to having each combat simply being a different strength rating die roll. Monsters each have their own set of attacks: A Cockatrice has "Stone x2" and "Claw x2" for its attack, and is immune to holy spells and vulnerable to fire; A Ghoul has "Fang x1" and "Poison x2" attacks, and is immune to stone, song, poison, and curse based attacks.

This game is monsters vs. monsters, neither player has characters that act as adventurers/heroes. There is the usual variety of spells and items and events to affect the outcomes of combat between the monsters.

6304.name: Level Up!
6304.description: A Fantasy card game, with art by the writer/artist of "Dragon Half". You play monsters, friends, and items. You defeat monsters to gain experience, and when you reach 4th level, you can then fight the final boss to win the game.

6305.name: Lemlican Series 3: Arms Collection
6305.description:
Final part of an ambitious 3-part attempt to make an RPG card game. This set provides many weapons, as well as various cards meant to make it also playable stand-alone.
However, it was really meant to be used with the others in the 3-part set.

Expands

Lemlican Series 1: Lemlican Musketeers Card RPG

6306.name: Gunbuster: Aim for the Top!
6306.description:
Alternate name: "Gunbuster : Top wo nerae!"

In this game, you play female giant robot pilots defending the human race from aliens. However, the girls are still high-school-age students, and spend as much time teasing and tormenting each other as they do fighting. You can put a tack on the cockpit seat of another girl, write graffiti all over someone else's robot, and spread rumors of them being lesbian, among other things.You encourage your own character, and yes, you do fight the aliens.

Art is by Mika Akitaka, who is the artist behind "Galaxy Fraulien Yuna" and is the mech designer of "Martian Successor Nadesico"

6307.name: Lemlican Series 2: Lemlican Monsters
6307.description:
2nd of an ambitious 3-part attempt to make an RPG card game. This set provides the monsters for the game.

Also playable as a stand-alone game, but really meant to be used with the others in the 3-part set.

Expands

Lemlican Series 1: Lemlican Musketeers Card RPG

6308.name: Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball Expansion Kit
6308.description:
This expansion requires the Wizardry Wiz Ball base game. This adds items and spells to the game, as well as more characters.

Expands:

Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball

6309.name: Lemlican Series 1: Lemlican Musketeers Card RPG
6309.description:
An ambitious 3-part attempt to make an RPG card game. This is the base set, this set providing characters, items, and some events.

Also playable as a stand-alone game, but really meant to be used with the others in the 3-part set.

Expanded by

Lemlican Series 2: Lemlican Monsters
Lemlican Series 3: Arms Collection

6310.name: Karate Master
6310.description: A Karate fighting game, and one of the few card games from Sho-Kikaku that does not use any Monster Maker characters.

6311.name: Kimagure Angels
6311.description: A fantasy card game about a groups/parties of characters that have been given a second chance at life. The players play good or evil angels, who grant parties of adventurers a second chance at life. You try to have them finish quests to support your cause.

6312.name: Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball
6312.description:
A fantasy sports game, fairly close in rules to baseball. There are many minor rules differences, and characters can be injured as well. You have a team of characters that each have their own statistics. You play cards based on what you pitch you expect the other team to throw, or attempt to throw a type of pitch the other team isn't expecting.

There is an expansion that adds items and spells to the game.

Expanded by:

Wizardry Card Game Wiz Ball Expansion Kit

6313.description: Sequel to the original, this is a stand alone game. It retains the theme (with a fantasy setting) of curing various ills of patients. Problems such as "critical hit" (an arrow in the forehead) abound, and events such as an uncured patient turning to an Undead can occur.
6313.name: Dynamite Nurse 2: Bloody Temple

6314.name: Dynamite Nurse
6314.description: Comical medical game. Slight fantasy feel, with catgirls and the like. Try to cure the illnesses of various people, with some occasionally less-than-efficient nurses (like the intern who completely slips when using her scalpel).

6315.name: Seriously Silly
6315.description: It will have you rolling on the floor with laughter... If you can even get the words out. Play this Seriously Silly game to learn from others what an "inflatable chicken" is and what a "mentholated hairline" is for. The trick is getting your opponent to believe you. So what are "freeze-dried underwear" for and what kind of person owns "turbo sheep"?

6316.name: Black Widow
6316.description: World War II air combat card game. Its a direct combat game; each card is a plane rated in many categories.

6317.name: Monster Maker: The Queen of Darkness
6317.description:
An amateur but near-professional quality unlicensed expansion for Monster Maker. Has additional cards, treasures, and events for Monster Maker. Requires the original Monster Maker game.

Expands:

Monster Maker

6318.name: Monster Maker: Space Trader
6318.description: The Monster Maker characters in a science-fiction theme. The game remains similar to the later games in the Monster Maker series, with player, monster, and treasure cards (but of course, no corridor cards).

6319.name: Monster Maker M3
6319.description: Amateur and very unofficial/unlicensed game based off Monster Maker. The box calls it "A Sexual Combat of Beautiful Gals in Monster Maker world". Sexual items are used to "arouse" the characters. Sorry, only the cover will be scanned, this is a family webpage.

6320.name: Gal Master 2
6320.description: Similar to the original Gal Master 1, this is a stand alone game. This adds a few new card types, such as one that requires a player to return all of their defeated monsters (and therefore go back to zero points), and ones that double or reverse the value of monsters.

6321.name: Tank Hunter
6321.description:
Detailed World War 2 card game that covers the ground war. Very ambitous, it covers many countries and their infantry, artillery, and tanks.

An optional expansion named Tank Buster was released, which adds terrain and event cards.

Expanded by:

Tank Buster

6322.name: Tank Buster
6322.description:
While it says it can be played as a stand-alone game, it is meant to be played as an expansion to Tank Hunter, and adds terrain and events to the units from the main game.

Expands:

Tank Hunter

6323.name: Gal Master 1
6323.description: In this game, each player starts with a set of 12 hero cards, numbered 1-12. The main deck of monsters is played one at a time, and each monster has a value (a few are even negative). Players then each play a hero card, and the high card kills the monster, and the player gets points equal to the value of the monster. If there is a tie, the highest non-tied character wins, so the winner when heroes rated 9,9,5,and 4 are played is the player who played the 5). At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.

6324.name: Horror Hunter
6324.description:
Players play the role of horror hunters, attempting to defeat monsters both magical (like vampires) and mundane (like psycho killers). The game has a light-hearted feel, with (unlicensed) use of many horror characters such as Jason, Freddy, and the girl from "The Exorcist."

Players are rated with attack strength and spiritual strength values. Monsters have strength ratings, terror points, and value ratings for when they're defeated. Events can lower your spiritual strength, and various insanities can afflict your character. Visits to a psychologist can restore your spiritual strength.

6325.name: Operation Barbarossa: Moscow Winter General
6325.description:
A World War 2 card game with mechanics similar to the same company's Monster Maker game. You play distance cards to represent the German's travel towards Moscow. There are enemy troops to interfere with your movement, and time cards simulate the passage of time (Winter saves Moscow!).

Includes rules for solo play, or works as a 2-6 player game as well.

6326.name: Monster Maker School Festival
6326.description:
Side-story to the main Monster Maker series, this is the 2nd in a series of card games featuring the Monster Maker characters in a still-fantasy high school setting.

In this game, there are various events at the school festival worth points to the player who plays the highest rating (1-10); if there is a tie, the highest non-tied ranking wins the event (so the winner when scores of 9,9,5,and 4 are played is the player who played the 5). Some events are unpopular and worth negative points that you don't want to win.

6327.name: Monster Maker School Excursion
6327.description:
Alternate title: Monster Maker Shuugaku Ryoukou

Side-story to the main Monster Maker series, this is the 3rd in a series of card games featuring the Monster Maker characters in a still-fantasy high school setting.

In this game, everyone goes on school vacations. You need to find someone to go together with; certain characters get along better with each other. You need to find an airplane that goes to the destination card you want to go to. Going on vacations to exotic places are worth the most points; vacations to the Dark Land are negative points.

6328.name: Monster Maker School
6328.description:
Alternate name: Monster Maker Gakuen

Side-story to the main Monster Maker series, this is the 1st in a series of card games featuring the Monster Maker characters in a still-fantasy high school setting.

In this one, try to match up characters to make them fall in love, but there are such things to worry about like having an ex-girlfriend Succubus.

6329.name: Europe 1520
6329.description:
If you like "Risk" and "Axis & Alies", you'll love this game. It's all the fun with half the learning. The year is 1520, a time of political and military upheaval as great empires juggled for world power. Meet face to face with great empires such as Ottoman, Iberian, Spanish, Mughal, Safid, Russian, Quing, Japanese, French, English, and more. Will you be the next great world leader? Play this classic strategy game and find out?

For details see http://ajaster.com/biglittlegames/europe1520.html

6330.name: Be Forever Yamato Game
6330.description:
Alternate name: Star Blazers Be forever Game

Based off the Space Battleship Yamato anime (known as Star blazers in the U.S.), the game comes in a very oversized box. It has a large board with a lot of different sections on it, with different gameplay on different parts of the board to simulate the epic story of the show.

6331.name: Cat's Eye: The Last Big Game
6331.description:
Based off the "Cat's Eye" anime show from the early 80s, about a trio of women thieves that wear leotard outfits and steal treasures.

Oversize game, with a very big multi-part board, along with many components (event cards, chips, information cards, roulette, playing pieces, and such).

6332.name: Arcadia of My Youth
6332.description:
Part of Bandai's "Game for Adult ~IF" series.

Game for Adult meaning aimed at older players, not anything with objectionable content.

Complexity 2 on Bandai's 1-7 scale (1=easiest)

"~If" just refers to the their gimmick of setting up each game in the series as a "What if... (insert game scenario)"

This particular game is based on the anime of the same name, and stars the character Captain Harlock. Uses large counters and area movement without multiple boards.

6333.description:
Mighty Warriors was produced in the early 1990s by Games Workshop as part of a series of introductory-level miniatures games. The four-game series included Mighty Warriors, Ultra Marines, Kerrunch, and Space Fleet. The game includes dice, floor tiles, door stand-ups, 36 highly detailed Citadel Miniatures, and reference cards for army lists and spells.

In Mighty Warriors, players choose from either a band of Heroes or Skaven Ratmen. The Heroes are led by a Noble Knight, a Fearless Dwarf, and a Heroic Elf while the Skaven Ratmen are led by a Chaos Wizard and four Skaven Champions. The Elf and Chaos Wizard can cast spells. The other characters have differing combat abilities.

Players set up the castle from modular floor tiles, which are then connected by stand-up doors. The players then position their forces throughout the rooms of the castle. Finally a “shield” for each side is placed.

The game is played in phases including Magic, Movement, Missile Combat, Melee Combat, and Recovery from Stuns. Each player attacks the other while moving from one room of the castle to another. A player wins by capturing the opponent’s shield.

This game is basically a “light” version of HeroQuest or Warhammer Quest, more of a skirmish style than exploration, Dungeon Crawl. The instructions state that the game is compatible with Ultra Marines so that players can have a fantasy versus science fiction battle.

Game Components

16 Skaven Warriors
4 Skaven Champions
12 Warriors
1 Knight
1 Elf
1 Dwarf
1 Chaos Wizard
1 Heroic shield
1 Chaos Shield
20 Door Stands
28 Black slotta Bases
4 Green Slotta Bases
4 Dice

Card Sheets:
MW1 - Heroic Army List
MW2 - Chaos Army List
MW3 - Chaos Spell Scroll
MW4 - Heroic Spell Scroll
MW5 - Dungeon
MW6 - Guard Room
MW7 - Ancient Temple
MW8 - Barracks
MW9 - Wizards Study
MW10 - Great Hall
MW11 - Doors (7 vertical wood)
MW12 - Doors (7 green vertical wood)
MW13 - Doors (3 diagonal wood, 3 spiked vertical wood)
MW14 - Library
MW15 - Vampires Chamber
MW16 - Treasure Room
MW17 - Alchemists Laboratory
MW18 - Dragon Chamber
MW19 - Skaven Lair
6333.name: Mighty Warriors

6335.name: Pargolf
6335.description: Pargolf does an amazing job of simulating the actual game of golf. The game is played over a challenging 6970 yard par 72 test of skill judgement and luck. It requires all the shots you have in the bag.

6336.name: 5 Card Nancy
6336.description:
5 Card Nancy is a card game invented by cartoonist Scott McCloud, author of "Understanding Comics" and "Reinventing Comics," and creator of the "Zot!" series of comic books (among others).
5 Card Nancy has never been published, so all existing sets have been constructed by hand.
The game is essentially an exercise in collaborative storytelling, played with a deck of cards. Each card in the deck features a single, unique panel taken from Ernie Bushmiller's classic newspaper comic-strip "Nancy." The strip is still in syndication today (and currently drawn by Guy Gilchrist), but McCloud insists that only panels from Bushmiller's peak years on the strip -- 1946 and later -- are suitable for use in a 5 Card Nancy deck.
Game play is very simple: an initial card is selected randomly from the draw pile and placed face up on the table. This card will serve as the first panel in the collaborative comic strip that will emerge as a result of gameplay. On her turn, a player will then select a single card from her hand, and place that card face up and to the right of the emerging comic strip. A judge or judges (usually the other players) then vote on the appropriateness of that particular panel to the unfolding narrative. If majority opinion favors the proposed panel, it becomes a part of the strip, otherwise it returns to the hand of the player who proposed it.

McCloud describes the game as a "Dada" game, by which he means a game in the spirit of the Dada movement.

6337.name: Coma: Guerra Biológica
6337.description:
The players take turns playing as Body defenses/medication/etc. (one per round), while all the other players play as external agents trying to take over the control of the body. The battle takes place using a schema of the human body, and the winner is the player, when playing as defense, who can eliminate all the aggressors.
It's a Brazilian boardgame made by one of the best game creator's of this country.

6338.description:
Tabletop Game about 1890-1945 era
Contains
Core Rules
Charts
Ship Data (Volume 1)
Log Sheets (for photocopy)
Game Box
Original Price 24,95

4th Edition was reprinted (three times) in 1988
6338.name: Seekrieg (Fourth Edition)

6339.name: Dying Lights
6339.description:
The galaxy is bleeding to death.
People are dying with each new nightfall as their very souls wither.
Their only hope lies in destruction, and you must teach them how to sow it...Dying Lights is a game of interstellar combat and survival for 2 or more players. The game is played using cards that represent starships, sectors of space, special combat maneuvers, the terrain on which battles are fought, and other such circumstances. The goal of the game is to ensure your faction's survival, whether through military force, heroic self-sacrifice, or simply outlasting the enemy.

6340.name: Golfer's Dominoes
6340.description: Golfer's Dominoes is a companion set to Dr. Miller's Golf Ace, with similar packaging and somewhat jocular, quirky rules, but there the similarity ends. Dominoes is, mechanically, a much simpler game, based on playing the most advantageous domino depicting one of seven possible golfing situations, from your hand of 4. The 28 dominoes are made of stiffened card and bear simple cartoon-style drawings of a golf ball lying on the fairway, beside a bunker, in a bunker, beside water, in water, beside the hole and in the hole. The player managing to place legitimately an "in the hole" domino with no hazard domino showing on any of the four ends of the pattern wins the hole. There is no counting of "strokes". The victor is simply the one who wins most holes.

6341.name: Conundrum
6341.description: Similar to the word game ghosts. Players alternate playing letter cards onto a string of cards that eventually forms a word - and when it does the person placed the last letter wins some chips from the pot - and the person who couldn't continue antes some chips. Cards can be played to front or end of the word, and there are some special cards, like wilds, and "inserts".

6342.name: Switchboard
6342.description:
The playing surface consists of 36 tiles laid out numerically to form a square. Each tile contains spots which form a pathway; some form straight paths, some are angled paths and some form crossroads. As players advance their tokens along the paths, they also move the tiles in an attempt to bottle up opponents while building the shortest possible path to the Finish for themselves. Thus, the pathway is continuously shifting, branching out, and breaking into segments.

Also published in 1965 as a promotional game for Culligan, title "Hey, Culligan Man!".

6343.name: You Just Became a Millionaire
6343.description: A player draws a card that poses a question, and each player predicts how others will answer. Players wager an amount on their prediction and then the question is answered, presumably honestly. The flavor hook to this game is that all players are immensely wealthy, and all the questions are about what they are going to do now that they are loaded.

6344.name: Power Moves
6344.description: A speed based game with 8 different card types. Players maintain a hand of 5 cards. Each time a card is played on the single play pile, it opens up the possibility for certain other cards to be played by any player. What cards you can play will depend on whether or not you have possession and what card preceded it. For example, a block can be played after a shot, but not after a 3 point shot, and after playing it the player would have possession, opening up the opportunity for a shot from them.

boardgamehonor: 1993 Mensa Select Winner
6345.description:
This is billed as "the ultimate tic-tac-toe" and has some resemblance to nine men's morris. The array is 4x4, and players alternate placing one of their 6 pieces on, placing one of the two wild pieces on, or moving/jumping with one of their pieces or the wild pieces. The goal is to get 4 in a row, make a square (2x2), or occupy all 4 corners. There are a number of anti-stalling rules and stakes raising, as in backgammon to round out the game.

1993 Mensa Select

Online Play


http://www.highergames.com
6345.name: Farook

6346.name: NBA Showdown
6346.description: A basketball trading card game. This game is notable for its fast play, accomplished by avoiding a shot by shot mechanism, instead having a quarter by quarter roll for each player. This gives the players points, assists, and rebounds. Additionally each player has a speed and power rating which factors into their matchups, and can get "hot" or "cold".

6347.name: Cargo
6347.description: With Cargo you are a forwarder and international trader. You buy goods an world markets, and , as a forwarder, you organize suitable means of transport, work out the routing, take over the forwarding jobs such as filling out the freight documents, customs clearing and shipping advices and in this way ensure streamlined progress from dispatcher to consignee. You will also have to struggle with the problems involved in forwarding but with good calculations, good counting and also a little luck you'll become a forwarder and businessman of worldwide experience...

6348.name: And Now For Something Completely Different... The Board Game
6348.description:
The game plays like Snake & Ladders on Spam.

Players line their markers on the “It’s” starting space, roll the die, move forward and try to reach the last space, an illustration of the Python foot. Should a marker land on certain spaces (rose stems and very long, Terry Gilliam-cartoon-like, winding arms), it goes backwards or forwards a certain number of spaces. A pretty simple, straightforward fare up until now, right? Right!
Now the Pythonian fun begins... Several spaces along the track are special and come in three different varieties: Task, Trivia and Character Type.

Task spaces require the active player to draw a Task card and perform the task described on it (e.g. Explain your theory on spontaneous combustion in which must be included goats, a kettle, Venus, a jelly babies and a sock with a hole in it). The other players then vote on the active player’s performance and, should the vote be positive, he gets an Award card (more on them later).

Trivia spaces require another player other than the active player do draw a Trivia card and read the Python-related question on it. If the answer is correct, another Award card is given.

Character types spaces have, well... character types on them (e.g. Canadian lumberjack, Spanish waiter, etc.) which the active player must take on as a persona until his next turn. If the other players decide he didn’t put in enough of an effort, they can just move his marker back to the starting space...

Finally, the Award cards. Apart from some flavor, most of these cards serve no other purpose other than being able to display your proud array of awards. The ones that do have game text on them require the player to perform some sort of task until the end of the game to keep the award.

6349.name: Riverboat Showdown
6349.description: With a hand of 8 cards, players must either play a lower card than one on display, taking chips from the kitty, a higher card, (paying chips into the kitty), or multiple cards which match the number on display. When one player plays all cards, the other players must pay that player chips equal to the remaining value of cards in their hand.

6350.name: Zomax
6350.description: Zomax uses a double sided metal hinged board and magnetic pieces representing tanks, ships and planes to represent a nation in turmoil. Normally 2 players (but it can be teams of people) sit on opposite sides of the board and take turns moving their units in an effort to capture the capitol which is placed somewhere on the board. All initial placement of pieces is secret. Movement is based on a dice roll, moving any combination of pieces a number of spaces equal to the total of the dice roll. If you drop a piece of your opponents (the magnets will repel each other and push the piece off the other side of the board), then your movement ends. There are mines that will destroy any piece that comes in contact with it. The first person to hit the capitol wins the game.

boardgamehonor: 2003 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2003 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Second Place
6351.description:
Each player is a Gulo, or wolverine, trying to rescue a baby Gulo who got caught by the swamp vulture whose eggs it was trying to steal. Unfortunately for the baby Gulo, all the adult Gulos are distracted by all the delicious swamp vulture eggs, and it has to wait very, very patiently as the adults constantly trip the very, very sensitive "egg alarm" rigged by the vulture to scare off the pesky Gulos.

There is a nice wooden bowl filled with multicolored swamp vulture eggs of various sizes, into which a long thin dowel with another egg at one end is inserted, like a flagpole. As you can imagine, lots of M&M Peanut-shaped wooden bits banging around together in a polished wooden bowl makes it rather difficult to keep a thin dowel with weight at the top balanced...

The essential mechanic of the game is to try to pull an egg of a particular color and move to a tile of that color on the linear path toward the bowl, and the little stack of tiles hiding the baby Gulo tile. If you set off the alarm, or knock any eggs out of the bowl, your Gulo is sent back to the previous tile of the attempted color. If there's no such tile, then back to the start he goes!
6351.name: Gulo Gulo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 16 : BGGcon 2015 Recap - Codenames - Favor of the Pharoah - Time Stories
OBG 018: The Culture of Game Consumption

boardgamehonor: 2003 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
6352.description:
A kids' game, with some minor decision points.

Players move from the Shire to Mount Doom, attempting to be the first hobbit to rid the world of the dark lord, Sauron. Along the way, they encounter friends to guide them or foes that can hinder their progress to Mount Doom. As the hobbits move through Middle-Earth the flying Nazgul are constantly trying to thwart their progress.

Also included in the game is a slightly more advanced version, where through the use of the Palantir, hobbits are discovered and delayed as they approach Mordor.

Do not confuse this kids game with Lord of the Rings, the cooperative game of the same name and by the same author!
6352.name: Lord of the Rings

boardgamehonor: 2003 Charles S. Roberts Best World War II Boardgame Nominee
6353.description:
(from the back of the box :)

Monty's Gamble: Market Garden is a simulation of the Allied attack in Holland. The Allied must land paratroopers, seize key bridges, and get XXX Corps up "Hell's Highway" to relieve the British paratroopers in Arnhem, all while the Germans are attempting to break their supply line.

Monty's Gamble features a semi-simultaneous movement System which provides maximum interaction and requires players to make tough choices as every move they make may be countered by their opponent. Both players will have pressing needs up and down "Hell's Highway" but may only address one at a time—hopefully before the variable turn length causes the turn to end!

CONTENTS:
1 Unmounted Mapsheet
2 Countersheets
1 Rulebook with history and designer notes
4 Setup Cards
4 Dice


(BGG description :)

An Area-Impulse game based on the game engine pioneered in Storm Over Arnhem and developed through Breakout: Normandy.
Monty's Gamble: Market-Garden covers the airborne drive into Holland in 1944 using the same basic system as Breakout: Normandy (with infiltration from Turning Point: Stalingrad thrown in).

The game features a basic game (4 days) and an extended game (5-10 days), and a game layout (including rules, examples of play, etc.) very similar to Breakout: Normandy.
6353.name: Monty's Gamble: Market Garden

6354.name: LAB
6354.description:
Your creations slowly come to life in the heart of the laboratory.

Have you been smart.

LAB is a miniatures game where you construct electrifying machines to feed your Kryo-chamber with resources. Then your dreadful creations emerge from the inner depths of your machine.

Every monster has unique features and the challenge is for you to construct a laboratory capable of creating the monsters you want in your horde. After that, you only have to make them obey...

The key to victory is to construct a laboratory optimal to the strategy you have chosen, and use it tactically while defending it from the opponent monsters and ordering your monsters to raze his laboratory.

6355.name: Cirondo
6355.description:
Played on a round board the object of the game is to eliminate your opponent(s) whilst remembering the game is about offense, defense and sacrifice.
You are to advance forward one space at a time with your moons, whilst defending them with your planets and setting up strategies to attack your opponent(s) stellars. When the moon reaches the inner ring it is sucked into the void and exchanged for a solar system. The solar systems are the most powerful stellar which every player is aiming to get. The planets are defending pieces which can only move in arcs around the board.
A great strategy game for 2 or 4 players or 2 teams of two.

6356.description:
Age of Steam expansion set with a double sided mapboard with England/Wales on one side and Ireland on the reverse.

The English/Wales map is designed for 5/6 players.

The Irish Map is designed for 3/4 players and has new rules to cover the special development of the Irish railway system.
6356.name: Age of Steam Expansion #1: England & Ireland

6357.description: Wild is a cribbage additive... it is a deck of 31 playing cards that are set beside the crib board. When a player counts a multiple of 5, that player draws a Wild card and follows the instructions on it.
6357.name: Wild: Cribbage Expansion

6358.name: Pack die Sieben
6358.description:
Promotional family game, published by Mercedes Benz & Ravensburger.

Theme
A road trip with grandma, grandpa, mum, dad and three children, who all have to be put into the car so that you can be the first to reach the holiday destination.

Goal
Be the first to reach the finish line by successfully completing activities and being lucky in a roll-and-move part.

Game play
The game is divided into two phases:

In phase 1, players try to fill their car (= their player board) as fast as possible. They do so by completing tasks from the activity cards.
The first area of the board shows a track consisting of spaces in six different colours. There is one pawn for all the players. Players take turns rolling the die and move the pawn accordingly. Depending on the colour of the space the pawn lands on, the active player has to

mime or draw one of two words from the card and the other players guess what it is,
read a story from the card and everyone guesses if it is true or false,
guess if the other players will raise an even or an odd number of fingers,
write down what they associate with a word, and the other players have to guess.




Players who successfully complete a task and players who guess correctly get to spin a spinner showing the different family members. If they haven't already got this family member, they take a matching chip and put it on their player board. Otherwise they have to gift it to someone else.

If the pawn lands on a light or dark pink space, players play "The magical 7" (trying to come as close as possible to 7 with two die rolls - the winner spins the spinner) or "Spinner poker" (betting one of your chips to get to spin the spinner twice - if the spinner points towards the family member you were betting on, you win that chip, otherwise you lose the one you bet).

Phase 2: Once a player has filled his/her car, he/she proceeds to the second part of the board. Here, each player has a car pawn. Players try to reach the finish line as fast as possible. Obstacle tokens and event spaces make you lose or win family members. If a player lands on a space that is already occupied, he/she can steal a family member to fill an empty spot in their own car.

The first player to reach the finish line wins the game.

6359.name: Lakeedah
6359.description:
Lakeedah is an exciting strategy game that's fast to learn and helps build critical thinking and planning skills while having fun. Both children and adults enjoy Lakeedah's varieties of play, which includes two-player, four-player, and team play variations that span the range from very strategic to fast and tactical.

Lakeedah is designed as an "Open Source" game, that is, players have the ability to create new game variations and submit them to this website and for possible inclusion in the Official Rulebook.

www.lakeedah.com

boardgamecompilation: Conflicts in American History: The Civil War Module 1
6360.description:
Increasingly regarded as THE pivotal battle of the civil war, this "mini" game is based on rule systems from Borodino and Austerlitz; and shares basic rules with others in the SPI Blue & Gray Folio Series (Chicamauga, Gettysburg and Shiloh) Scale is 400 meters/hex. 1-2 hours per Game Turn. Union Movement Restrictions are used to reflect McClellan's lack of aggression.

Rigid Zones of Control, retreat and advance after combat, and Sequential Player Turns are common to these games, but a new concept, "Attack Effectiveness" is introduced. Surrounding to cut off retreat is a major strategy.

Fairly wide open terrain, defense specifics (like Bloody Lane) are not detailed but "Burnside Bridge" is.
6360.name: Antietam: The Bloodiest Day, 17 September 1862

6361.description:
(from the box)

A 3-Dimensional fearful fun game - but watch out! The ghosts are out to get you.

Turn the wheels and run the gauntlet of ghastly ghouls! Get caught in the spookey spider's web! Sit with skeletons in the haunted waiting room!


Ghost Train is a British game based on those haunted amusement park rides.

The gameboard simulates the inside of a 'Ghost Train' complete with lurking ghosts, bats, skeletons and spiders, etc.

The mechanics (spinning tracks which change direction of movement) are the same as those in the Walt Disney Haunted Mansion Ride Game.

The game simulates many of the 'quirks' of such rides including sudden and jolting changes of direction, dead stops, being 'stuck' at one of the exhibits, and mechanical moving spooks.

Game Play:

Players enter the Ghost Train form the outside in little buggies and navigate the ride while being subjected to detours, directional changes, dead ends, delays and all sorts of creepy monsters.

Players can occasionally spin the turntables to either change a buggies direction (inside the circle) or have an attacked spook knock over an opponents buggy back (outside track) sending it to the 'waiting room'.

There is also a giant swinging spider guarding the exit!
6361.name: Ghost Train

6362.name: Airport
6362.description:
This is a simple family boardgame. Each player operates a delivery company which deliver goods for customers from one city to another via airplanes. Players play card from their hands to finish the delivery job. Amount of money obtained is also written on the cards.

On the map, each city can only be occupied by a player. So hand management is important in planning ones' own delivery routes.

6363.name: Monopoly: World Cup France '98 Edition
6363.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is a World Cup 98 edition. Each block on the map represents a national soccer team.

6364.name: Monopoly: Hong Kong
6364.description:
This is the Hong Kong limited edition released by Hasbro HK.
Each block on the map represents a famous location in Hong Kong.

6365.name: The Totally Insane Card Game
6365.description:
Quick Introduction To
The Totally Insane Card Game Ô

The Totally Insane Card Game plays “like” you would play UNO®, only with 27 action cards and lots of fun new twists. The game ends when a player reaches 500 points, lowest score wins.
The Totally Insane Card Game has numbered cards 0-10 and 27 action cards such as the Change Hands. If you do not like the cards in your hand, you think another player MAY have a better hand, play the Change Hands to the discard pile and change hands with him. Other examples of action cards are the Moving Cards, these cards when played, will move the entire hand of all players ether two players left or one player right. The Totally Insane Card Game includes Draw 2, Draw 4, and Take 2, cards that make the next player ether Draw 2 or Draw 4 cards from the draw pile, or Take 2 cards from any player. Of course the draw cards add together so you might have to draw 6 or 8 cards. In Totally Insane, players could take cards from your hand, helping you get rid of your cards, while adding cards to their hand. The Totally Insane Card Game has a Totally Useless Card this card is exactly what it says totally useless. At no time can the Totally Useless Card be played to the discard pile. So what do you do with a card you can’t play to the discard pile? Simple, you give it to anther player so he can’t play it either. (If you can’t play it, you can’t go out.) You can give it away with cards like the Change Hands, Moving Card, or a Forced Kindness. When you play a Forced Kindness to the discard pile, you give two cards from your hand to any player. You never know who will be picked on next. The Totally Insane Card Game boasts one Dead Card, any time this card is played to the discard pile, the hand is over immediately all players add the points of there cards, then deal the next hand. This is just a sample of the action cards and how they play.
The Totally Insane Card Game is designed to play in turn and out of turn, (matching) so you must be alert, or you may miss an opportunity to play a card.
The Totally Insane Card Game is fast moving and outrageous fun, for 4 to 12 players Ages 8 and up.
Find us at totallyinsanecardgame.com

6366.description:
A cooperative dungeon crawl game in which a party of four heroes strives to complete adventures that the Dungeon Master puts before them. Quite similar to HeroQuest.

Expanded by:

Eternal Winter Expansion Pack(2003)

Forbidden Forest Expansion Pack(2004)
6366.name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

6367.name: Make 7
6367.description:
Players take turns dropping numbered tiles down one of the seven columns. The objective is to be the first to place tiles adjacent to each other (vertically, horizontally, or diagonally) so that the sum of the numbers on the tiles is 7.

Tiles with the number '3' can only be placed in spots with a red border, so there is some positioning that takes place to try to force your opponent into making moves that allow you to place your '3' tiles.

boardgamehonor: 2003 Spiel der Spiele Game of the Year Winner
6368.description:
England in the Middle Ages is seeking a King. Knights from across the land go on exciting and adventurous quests with one goal in mind: to pull the sword Excalibur from the stone and claim the throne. As in the story, the game lets players take the role of knights wandering from town to town and adventure to adventure. While doing so, they encounter the saga's heroes - bridge guardians, generous barkeeps, successful noblemen - who influence the events of the game. Their voices can be heard from the giant fist-sized stone that is fastened to the gameboard and in which Excalibur rests.

The electronics of the game pay attention throughout and remember every move of every player: Good deeds are rewarded and un-knightly deeds punished by friendly (or less friendly!) characters which speak to the players through the stone.
6368.name: King Arthur
boardgamefamily: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

6371.name: Thunderbirds Mission Alert
6371.description:
If you have to smile when you think back to the cheesy special effects of your childhood, you’ll love this nod to the classic “supermarionation” series, Thunderbirds. More than a nod to nostalgia, this game features completing exciting missions to win. The board features Tracy Island in the center (which is home base) and five zones: Space, Air, Oil Rig, Underground and City. Draw Mission cards to see where you’ll go, who will lead, what vehicle you’ll use, what you will accomplish and how many points your mission is worth. Complete the mission and return to Tracy Island safely and you'll get the points. At the end of the game, add up your points to see who wins!

Contents:
66 Thunderbird Cards
25 Mission Cards
24 Equipment Cards
17 Thunderbird 5 Cards
6 Pawns
1 die.

For 2 to 6 players.

6372.name: Recycling
6372.description: The object of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all of their waste without going broke. The theme is about recycling products, and appropriately, the game components are all recycled materials: milk caps for movers, various beads and plastic chips for the waste products, etc.

6373.name: Star Poker
6373.description:
Object
Create poker hands - pairs, straights, flushes, etc. - to score points. After all the tiles have been played, the player with the highest score wins!

Contents
54 poker tiles including 2 jokers
Scoring chips: Blue = 5 points, Red = 10 points, White = 25 points
7 racks
Disk
Label
Score card

Set up
Players draw a tile from the "pool;" the one with the highest tile goes first, then play moves in a clockwise direction. Return those tiles to the pool and mix them.

Playing
On a turn, place a tile on one of the seven sides of the disk. Then take a tile from the pool so that you always have five tiles in your hand. Play continues to the second player who can place a tile after the tile just played, or on any of the other sides of the disk. Then he takes a tile from the pool. Players continue taking their turns until someone scores.

Scoring
Players score by making various poker hands: 1 Pair, 3 of a Kind, Full House, Straight, etc. (see POKER HANDS). The hands are formed by combining the last or "open" tiles in any of the paths leading from the disk.

Blocking
When you do not have a tile that you can lay down to score points, you may want to block the other players from scoring.

5 Tile Plays
Any time a player scores by creating a 5 of a Kind, Full House, Straight, Flush, Straight Flush, Royal Flush after receiving his points for that round, ALL of those tiles that were used to score are turned face down so that they cannot be used again. Players can play tiles from their hands off of the turned down tiles, as if starting from the beginning (tiles placed before the turned-down tiles cannot be used to form hands).

Note: Do not turn the tiles over upon creating 2 pairs and 4 of a Kind. This allows for the creation of a Full House and 5 of a Kind.

Jokers
A joker can be used as a "Wild Card" to represent a ny tile. (Color does not matter - a red joker can represent a spade or club, etc.) The player that places a joker determines what tile it represents; the joker will remain as that chosen tile for the rest of the game. If another player holds the tile that the joker represents, he can play that tile as well.

Points Chart
Some of the scoring in Star Poker differs from the scoring in the standard poker game. This is due to the probabilities of creating different hands.

1 Pair = 5 pts.
2 Pairs = 10 pts.
3 of a Kind = 30 pts.
4 of a Kind = 75 pts.
5 of a Kind = 100 pts.
Full House = 40 pts.
Straight = 50 pts.
Flush = 50 pts.
Straight Flush = 100 pts.
Royal Flush = 100 pts.
Blue Chips = 5 pts.
Red Chips = 10 pts.
White Chips = 25 pts.

Ending and Winning the Game
Players continue until there are no more tiles to draw from and all tiles in their hands have been placed. In a four player game, once a player draws the tile that leaves two tiles left, the game ends after that player takes his turn. In a five player game, play until there are four tiles left and in a seven player game, play until five tiles are left. The player with the most points wins.

boardgamehonor: 2003 Charles S. Roberts Best Magazine-Published Boardgame Nominee
6374.description:
(from ATO website:)

Napoleon at the Berezina is a solitaire game of the last major action of the 1812 campaign. Disintegrating as it moved along, the French army was faced with total destruction if the three converging Russian armies caught the French army with its back against the Berezina River. A way had to be found across the river before that happened.

Being a solitaire game, the player should imagine himself as the French side "fighting a colossus of blind automata". The solitaire rules combine a set of parameters for movement, with a system for authorizing Russian movement and other actions via a track that monitors overall Russian morale and successes to date to assist the player in running a challenging automaton.

Complexity - Low
Solitaire Suitability - High

Full color 22"x34" map
200 full color die cut counters
boardgameversion: Against the Odds Boxed First edition
6374.name: Napoleon at the Berezina

6375.description:
An educational game for 2 to 6 players, set in early America. Each player begins the game as an indentured servant, who must first earn his or her freedom, then collect a list of required items for day to day life. Items are obtained from various shops and are also bought and sold in the marketplace, in exchange for shillings or in trade for other items. Along the way, various events in history shake things up. Players visit the many different buildings in a colonial American town (tavern, inn, jail, church, etc.) and find ways to strip other players of their belongings and negotiate trade. When one player collects all the items on his or her list and ends the game, the player with the most assets becomes the winner.

Rules contain 3 different levels of difficulty so that the game can be tailored to different age groups (Ages 8 and up, Ages 10 and up, and Ages 12 and up). The game was developed in cooperation with the Winterthur Museum.
6375.name: Made for Trade

6376.description:
L'Encanteur - the French fish auctioneer
The bidding's master of ceremony - l'encanteur - used to sing prices.
The song-bidding system is a two-phase process : first, the price decreasing phase and then the price increasing phase.
Each player impersonates a restaurant owner.

Goal : Be the first to serve your secret fish-combination after having made your shopping at the song-bidding.
Game turns are played by pairs : morning is when you go to the song-bidding and buy your different species of fish or seafood, afternoon is when you try to serve the best your clients.

Number of players : 3 or 4
Ages 8 and up
Average length : 15-20 mn.
Number of cards : 110 cards (rulebook in French, English, Dutch, German)
